title: What are some of the ways I can take care of my new laptop? - Quora

response.answer_text: You always wish to buy a Laptop with latest technology, advance features and of attractive looking. Your new laptop always attracts attention of others. It will reflect your personality when you will use it for your official purpose. It will show your comfort level when you will use it for entertainment. It will convey your sincerity when you will use it for study and education purpose. It will help you to pay dedication on your work even during travel. It can make you effective and efficient while collecting information for teaching or training purpose. It helps you to manage your time by making online shopping.  A laptop looks so attractive when it is new.  But it looks dirty & grimy when it becomes old. Why…?? So, we can say laptop has become an important tool to survive in today’s world of technology. Laptop is being widely utilized in every field. Its portable feature allows users to carry it anywhere and can connect people around the world through WiFi facility. Because it is a portable device, you can use it while taking lunch or dinner, while travelling, while doing exercise, and in any other situation. So, it is obvious that you will touch and use your laptop with oily hands, dirty hands or with your muddy hands. Even in any season either rain, cyclone, summer or winter you will use your laptop to accomplish your task or duties. But you must accept one truth that your dynamic use of laptop also makes it dirty. Your finger prints on laptop, food particles, liquid spots like spots of tea & coffee or sauce or cheese or butter on your laptop make it looks poor, dull, colorless and old. So, you need to clean your laptop regularly to keep it new and always attractive looking. But how you can clean and maintain your laptop…? There are some commonly used methods for cleaning laptop like wipe-off with a dry cloth, wipe-off with a wet cloth, using some commercial spray and cleaners, etc. But do you have any idea that such methods of cleaning and maintaining your laptop are totally wrong…? Yes, these methods are wrong. Laptop body, keyboard and screen are sensitive surface which need to be cleaned and maintained with enough precautions. By applying wrong chemical or spray can damage its shine and looks. Using any ordinary cloth for cleaning can create scratches on your laptop surface. So, you need to follow some precautionary steps to maintain your laptop. Never store your laptop in any ordinary carry bag. Always use Laptop carry bag. It will protect your laptop body from getting scratches over it.Avoid using laptop with dirty or oily hands. If you have used it with dirty or oily hands than clean your laptop as soon as possible.Always clean your laptop especially after it is being used by others. Because others may not follow such precautions.Always wipe of dust from your laptop body surface and from the screen.Always use Microfiber Cloth for wiping of the dust from your laptop. Because Microfiber cloth will absorb dust and make it clean. Using of any other ordinary cloth for cleaning may create scratches on your laptop body surface or even on the screen.Always use authenticated wax based laptop cleaner like “CROWN MIN CREAM”. Because it can “Clean, Shine & Protect” your laptop surface and always keep your laptop new.

Here are a few pointers that might help: 1. Don't keep the battery at 100% all the time. if you're not using it, remove it. If you can't (or don't want to), cap the battery at 80% at max (I keep mine at 60%). There are softwares usually provided by Dell for doing this AFAIK. 2. Don't let it overheat. Anything that heats up the laptop is a big no-no. (Games, softwares etc.). If your laptop can't handle it without heating, better let it go. 3. Don't keep the laptop on your lap. The ventilation on the bottom get blocked by your clothes which starts heating the laptop. By extension, bed and sofas are not suitable as well. Plain surfaces like table or a desk will do. 4. Don't keep the laptop on dusty surfaces. The dust gets through the ventilation and dirties the fans. 5. If you spill water/juice/soda, shut off the laptop immediately, remove the batteries and let it dry for atleast 24 hours.  A couple myths: MYTH 1: You have to drain the battery atleast once a month to avoid the memory effect.People might say you have to drain the battery completely and charge it fully in order to avoid the memory effect. Let me enlighten you on this topic. It's all hokum.  It's a thing of the past. Modern lithium ion batteries don't have this problem.  MYTH 2: Batteries get overcharged if not unplugged and get damaged.You cannot overcharge the battery. The manufacturers are smart enough to keep a check on when the battery is full. Once it's full, they stop charging the battery and provide direct AC current to the laptop.
